Salutem plurimam tuae, uxoris, liberisque tuis.
Dear Henry, You have our beloved Megandrum, a living letter of all things that you wish to know about our church. Enjoy and be filled by its conversation. I wish I had the blessing to be able to have a conversation with you, Pellicanus, Leo, and the others for long nights! I am always forced, willing or not, to stay in my corner and can only do what I would rather do and what I can do in front of my brothers with paper. You are the only one who does not blush or regret to adjust himself to all my needs and, which I consider the greatest of all, with a sincere and full heart of love. May the Lord grant me the privilege to be appointed to his service, or may he grant you all to me, or may he preserve you in good health in Zurich for many years, not only for our churches and brothers, but for the whole Christian republic! Do what you have promised to do. I am looking forward to Bartholomew's feast, in which, if you do not come, you will finally experience that I really wrote you that you will never see me in Bern. I send back your letter to Bucerus with the advice we gave. Everything pleases and may the judges be fair. Let me know how it is with Bucerus now. My warmest regards to you, your wife and your children.

I am sending your letter to Bucer, together with the advice that we gave.Everything is pleasing, and may the judges be just!I would like to know how things are going with Bucer.I would also like to have a copy of his letter, or from whom did you hear such news through Sebastian Zofingam?The integrity of the Argentinian brothers is otherwise known, unless they have changed now.
Who would not be displeased with Hebrew commentaries, unless someone who is pleased with nothing?Continue.Nothing is holding me back, since Megander, the language expert, sees no commentaries.I am pleased with both yours and Pellicanus', and I say this without flattery.I see there is no ostentation, no disputation, but sincerity, and that the true sense of scripture is given to us, as long as both of you continue.
You can learn from the records of the Anabaptists, what was done by Zofinga.I would need your advice, what means the magistrate should use to suppress this sect.I fear it may thirst for too much of their blood, and I also fear that too much indulgence will be very disadvantageous to the churches.Wherever you can, let me know through Megander by letter.Therefore, what has been added to the Hebrews and the commentaries of Pellicanus must be sent in a bundle through the servant of Megander.
Tete, I say, I desire to see and hear you once, face to face.I will provide the money, and you be the traveler, most beloved and beloved Heinricus, and there is no need to communicate your arrival more, as long as I could be certain of it.Farewell, and may this be forever with your wife, family, brothers and acquaintances, and let me know if your brother has been with you, even in a single word.

Your smallest but most devoted coin.
There is one here, sent to be pastor at Boswil, who is very bad.If you know him, tell me what his testimony is.Otherwise, I write these letters, which are very rich in testifying of my mind in you, only to you.Always and forever, be well and farewell.
To Heinricus Bullinger, the Tigurine clergyman, to his most beloved brother.
